metadata.title: CVE-2020-29443 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
ide_atapi_cmd_reply_end in hw/ide/atapi.c in QEMU 5.1.0 allowsout-of-bounds read access because a buffer index is not validated.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-29443` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.35
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.35
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.35
qemu-kvm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.35
qemu-system - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.35
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.35
qemu-system-common - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.35
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.35
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.35
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.35
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.35
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.35
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.35
qemu-user - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.35
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.35
qemu-user-static - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.35
qemu-utils - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.35
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.35').
